Name: 2023 Winemaking Handbook Cover
Project Description: White Rabbit contemplates the mysteries of winemaking.

Name: Alan Just Self Portrait
Project Description:
Oh, early days.

In the realm of self-expression, my self-portrait emerges as a humble testament, influenced by the creative spirits of Chuck Close and Robert Arneson. Chuck's intricate dance with scale and disposition, as well as Robert's vibrant interplay of color and whimsy, have shaped this visual tapestry.

Speaking of scale, this boy is big – 40in x 60in.

‍

Name: Anvil by Forgeron Cellars
Project Description:
Anvil is a vanity wine priced at $40-$50 to showcase the skills and talent of Forgeron Cellar's winemaker, Marie-Eve Gilla.

What is unique about the illustration is its modernization of a traditional 19th-century steel cut engraving style.

My approach to design is to make the design sturdy, resistant to the rigors and inconsistencies of production. I like to use foil, hot stamping and embossing as well as most designers. I make sure the success of the design will survive their absence.

‍

Name: Breyer's Gelato Style Ice Cream - Concepts
Project Name: Breyer's Gelato Style Ice Cream - Concepts
Project Description:
I used to work at a large Midwest agency where I was assigned to manage the Breyer's Ice Cream account. My primary responsibility was to design seasonal flavor carton graphics for the brand.

However, what I found most enjoyable was exploring their various "concept" offerings and visualizing how they would look on the shelves. It was a great opportunity to flex my creative muscles and come up with unique and eye-catching designs.

Restaurants and specialty shops in larger, up-scale U.S. markets were serving the Italian–style ice cream, gelato, to an enthusiastic and rapidly growing market. I developed several soft-serve style ice cream design prototypes that leveraged Breyer's position as leader in the "All Natural" indulgent food category.

‍

Name: Colt Premium Beer Identity
Project Description:
Colt 45, a malt liquor, was a favorite beverage of young inner-city males. The goal was to create a product line extension of Colt 45 that would appeal to this upwardly mobile demographic as their tastes shifted more and more upscale.

‍

Name: Connie Portrait
Project Description: This moment captures my sister the morning after her bridal shower. Yep, she's glowering at her little brother while he snaps a photo taken with an Argus C3 camera that he purchased from Roone Arlidge in 1963.

Name: Harry & David Cocktail Mixers
Project Description: Delicious mixers

Name: Harry & David Gift Tower - Concept
Project Description:
This is one of several gift tower ides that where presented at design review.

‍

Name: Java Jacket Logo
Project Description:
This is the most ubiquitous coffee sleeve protector in the business.

It is designed to provide a layer of protection for the hand holding the cup, preventing direct contact with the hot surface and reducing the risk of burns. The Java Jacket acts as a barrier, insulating the heat and improving grip, making it more comfortable to hold and carry hot drinks.

Name: Lone Star Identity and Packaging
Project Name: Lone Star Beer Label and Packaging Rebrand Design
Project Description:
Lone Star was a dying brand, and the goal of this redesign was to reverse that trend. The challenge was that the existing label was much loved, even by people who didn’t consume the beverage. In addition, it’s an icon of the state of Texas, and its citizens are very proud of it. I had to create a new look that wouldn’t alienate current consumers but that would also draw in new drinkers.

Success. Sales increased 60% in the first full year after the new look was released due to increased retail support and stronger on-shelf presence.

Effective—

Increased net sales

Additional demographic

Efficient—

Direct design lead

Direct communication

On time

On budget

13 SKUs

8 weeks

‍

Name: Old Milwaukee Sweepstakes
Project Description:
Old Milwaukee was losing 8% market share per year as consumers were either dying off or switching to other liquors. The company wasn’t doing any marketing, and they hadn’t freshened their packaging graphics in years.

The big idea behind this new campaign was to build awareness among males 21 - 25 with sweepstakes and promotions, the first of which was an all-expenses-paid trip for two to the Pro Bowl in Honolulu.

To create shock value and take advantage of a fun play on words, I created this campaign that “vandalized” the brand name by replacing “waukee” with “waikiki”. Though many people in the industry though what I’d done to the brand was despicable, this packaging nevertheless went on to win an award.

The eye-grabbing image of a football crashing through the packaging was used as the central icon on all of the point-of-sale promotion items.

Thanks to this promotion, Old Milwaukee reversed its trend, increasing sales by 4%.

‍

Name: Old Style Beer Cubs Ivy Can
Project Name: Old Style Beer Cubs Ivy Can
Project Description: Old Style commemorated their 50 year partnership with the Chicago Cubs and Wrigley Field. This package was sold exclusively during one season at the ballpark. As Wrigley Field is known for the ivy on its brick outfield walls, this can was a big hit with fans.

Name: Pabst Blue Ribbon Light
Project Name: PBR Light Bottle and Can Packaging
Project Description:
Pabst was keen on expanding its share of female drinkers, which trended towards light and low calorie alcoholic beverages. The success that Pabst was having with its legacy Pabst Blue Ribbon workhorse among educated male twenty and thirty-something males forecasted an opportunity with that group’s female population.

I’d just returned from the UK where, at that time, they were using transparent ink on metal cans. US can printers had never used transparent inks. I thought it had a great look, one that communicated premium and female—especially if adorned in the traditional blue hues of premium light beer. With the delicate design elements cuing upscale and feminine, it was guaranteed to connect. Pabst loved it.

Lots of SKUs—labels and packaging design for bottles, cans, baskets, racks, etc.

Name: Paul Missal Portrait
Project Description:
Paul Missal was my main influence in art school. Lovely man.

I painted this just for fun.

Name: PBR Light - Concept
Project Description:
During the development of PBR Light I explored and presented well over 100 designs. This is my favorite alternate.

‍

Name: Pete's Head
Project Description:
Everything I do tends to be proof of concept. This piece is no exception.

Acrylic,  60" x 40".

It's constructed with black diner vinyl, wood, and sculpted cushion foam.

Name: PetSmart Gift Card & Carrier Sets
Project Description:
PetSmart generates over $90 million annually in offsite gift card sales.

The "Joy Fish" set on the far left was PetSmart Canada's top Holiday seller.

The objective was to raise awareness and increase sales in the small animal/specialty pet category.

Name: Petsmart's Simply Nourish SOURCE Petfood Packaging
Project Name: Petsmart's Simply Nourish SOURCE Petfood Packaging
Project Description:
PetSmart's new super-premium entry offers trend-sensitive pet owners a convenient source that simulates the prototypical diet.

The design directive was to reassure the shopper of its value, differentiate the product from the category leader while supporting its premium price position.

Name: Scott Lab Fermentation 2009 Handbook
Project Description:
Think of the effect that the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue has on its audience and you can begin to understand how winemakers across the country feel when their copy of this handbook arrives. Fantasy and possibility—the secret for making the world’s next great wine lies somewhere between these covers.

The 2009 handbook design delivers the message that what's offered inside will empower the winemaker to create wines of unsurpassed aroma and flavor.

‍

Name: Scott Lab Fermentation Handbook Celebrating 75 Years of Character
Project Name: Scott Lab Fermentation Handbook Celebrating 75 Years of Character
Project Description: I developed the design and illustration as tongue-in-cheek metaphors of commonly used wine descriptors often read on the back of wine labels.

Name: Scott Lab Fermentation Handbook the Game Of Wine
Project Name: Scott Lab Fermentation Handbook the Game Of Wine
Project Description:
This is another example of Scott Lab's highly technical fermentation catalog where I use art and design to engage an audience that is in the very-serious-business of wine making.

‍

Name: Tempus Cellars Wine Labels
Project Description:
This is Joe and Molly's first vintage. The tortoise on the label tells the story of Joe's painstaking attention and persistence in producing one of Washington states finer offerings.

The label is designed to communicate, at shelf, the wine's value relative to its thirty-dollar price.

Name: Waldeaux Smithie & Waldette Wine Labels
Project Name: Forgeron Cellars Table Red and White Wine Labels
Project Description:
Walldeaux Smithie and Walldette had to clearly communicate their value in the ten to 20 dollar red wine and white wine category.

The bold illustration style speaks to Walldeaux Smithie's and Walldette's wild west sensibilities and french background. While leveraging the reputation of the parent winery—Forgeron Cellars—Walldeaux's compact good looks and Walldette's coquettish charm, establishes their own distinct identity.

Name: Wolferman's "Be Merry" Gift Tin
Project Description: One of meany gift SKUs I created for Wolferman's Bakery

Name: Wolferman's Holiday Tote and Muffin Labels
Project Name: Wolferman's Holiday Tote and Muffin Labels
Project Description:
I created the muffin bag labels.

Also featured is the tote holidy design.
